channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report X-2024010391
item.description:
Report X-2024010391

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-10
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: TWO PACKAGES WERE INSPECTED DUE TO BEING COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED DRY ICE COOLING PET FOOD IN BOTH PACKAGES. ONE PACKAGE HAD 4.30 POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING PET FOOD. SECOND PACKAGE TRACKING NUMBER 1Z1433240212873642 CONTAINED 1.55 POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING PET FOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS SHIPPING IN THE AIR NETWORK. THE THERMAL LABEL DESCRIPTIONS ARE FROZEN MEAT. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2024010465
item.description:
Report X-2024010465

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: As the package was being unloaded the package handler noticed the side of the box was wet. DescribePack: Loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once the package was discovered the box was set inside a hazmat tote, taken to the damaged hazmat cage, and set under the vent.

item.title: Report X-2024010178
item.description:
Report X-2024010178

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-13
  • City: AUBURN
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Broken pallet was removed from the package flow and brought to for QA inspection. Upon inspection, package contained Dyno Battery (50-25 industrial cell) packaged on top of a small wooden pallet wrapped in plastic wrap. There was no hazmat labeling or markings on the package. DescribePack: Wooden pallet was broken, and the battery had spilled out some of its content from inside. The cause of the damage is unknown. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was isolated from the package flow, and it was immediately placed inside a salvage drum after inspection.
